* Support for JML assume & assert statements
* Support for ensures_free & requires_free on block contracts

This branch is based on !306

milestone.title: v2.10.0
milestone.description:
The next major version after 2.8.0. 

We decided the following in the KaKeY meetings:
* feature freeze: November 15th
* subsequently: testing by Hiwis
* first week of December: testing and bug fixing event with staff
* release date: shortly prior to christmas, such that it is available for teaching in formal methods course

title: overhaul of the feedback button.
description: This is a minor UI tweak which does no longer try to open a mail window but lets one simply save the report as a zip file.

title: fixing 2 book examples to take new settings into account.
description:
Method inlining is not allowed by default in KeY.
Adding "final" to the class makes sure that there no unknown subclasses.

````
class Person {
````

became

````
/* This class is declared final to allow inlining of the method body.
 * If it were not declareed final there might be a subclass of Person
 * with a different implementation.
 */

public final class Person {
````

/cc @ahrendt

title: RunAllProofs in UI
description:
This MR adds an action (under `file -> prove -> run all proofs`) 
for automatically running a pre-defined set of proofs in the UI.

title: Downgrade junit to 4.12
description:
The KeY master is currently not stable during testing, sometimes the error `OutOfMemory` occurs, due to missing of java heap space. 

This problem could be created due to the upgrade from junit 4.12 to 4.13.1. 

This MR reverse this upgrade.

title: Fix SMTSettings (!300 w/ less changes)
description:
The same patch as !300, but without refactoring of `key.core`.

> This MR fixes some missing features and bugs from the UI of SMT Solvers:
> 
> * Solver Settings are set into the smt-proof-independent-settings, also on `Apply` a check for installation is triggered.
> * `Check for Support` is back
> * Solver name and version are always marked as erroneous (red)
> * Refactoring: Externalising the lengthy UI texts

title: Fix/add loop scope unwind
description: On the current master, the loop scope unwinding rule got lost, although it's promised in the strategy options. Clear bug. This merge request adds the rule as it's proposed in @wasser's thesis, with a nested modality. Currently, we're running in endless loops then since SE selects the loop before executing the unwound part...

title: SourceView: Enable syntax highlighting for JML starting with annotation markers
description:
Fix for bug/feature request #1545:
JML starting with annotation markers (according to JML reference manual 4.4, http://www.eecs.ucf.edu/~leavens/JML/jmlrefman/jmlrefman_4.html#SEC29) is now correctly syntax highlighted in SourceView.

Closes #1545.

title: Testgen UI via UI extension
description:
The module `key.core.testgen` is currently not maintained. This MR lowers the dependencies of `key.ui` to this module, allowing an easy removal of `key.core.testgen` in the future.

This MR refactors out the classes depending on `key.core.testgen` in `key.ui` into a separate module `keyext.ui.testgen`. I also fixed the errors and smells identified by SonarQube.

**All features of testgen are still available in KeY ui.**

## Changes

* New gradle module `keyext.ui.testgen`
  * containing the old classes for actions, settings panel etc. from `key.ui`
  * `KeyGuiExtension` implementation to provide main-menu entries and toolbar.
* Change the dependency from `compile 'key.core.testgen` to `runtimeOnly 'keyext.ui.testgen`.

**Attention:** This MR contains also `weigl/sonar`. 

Analysis results: [SonarQube](https://sonarcloud.io/dashboard?id=key-main&pullRequest=324)

title: Enabling of SonarQube in Merge Requests
description:
This MR brings SonarQube and SonarCloud.io to KeY. SonarQube is a software assessment system, think of a combination of FindBugs, PMD, and Checkstyle, with a nice GUI. This MR adds SonarQube to gradle and also adds a new gitlab-ci tasks.
SonarQube supports the differential analysis, thus only newly introduce issues are considered---similarly to our checkstyle. 
In contrast to checkstyle, SonarQube distinguish between bugs (something that lead to unexpected behavior) and code smells (violation against common code format).  The run time of the analysis is roughly 8 minutes.

Here you find already analysed branches/MR:
* https://sonarcloud.io/dashboard?id=key-main
* !323 [weigl/sonar](https://sonarcloud.io/dashboard?id=key-main&pullRequest=323)
* !278 [weigl/kp2](https://sonarcloud.io/dashboard?id=key-main&pullRequest=278)
* !306 [weigl/jmlp](https://sonarcloud.io/dashboard?id=key-main&pullRequest=306) 

I think we should try it. The removal is trivial. 

**Note:** Code coverage is currently not configured and requires, that the sonarqube runs after the tests with jacoco activated.

**Note 2:** Rules and *quality gate* are configured via the web ui.


**Update:** 

*Quality Gate* were adapted to the following constraints:

> Conditions on New Code 
> 
> Conditions on New Code apply to all branches and to Pull Requests.
>
> * Maintainability Rating	is worse than	A		
> * Bugs	is greater than	0		
> * Code Smells	is greater than	250		
> * Reliability Rating	is worse than	A		
> * Security Rating	is worse than	A

title: bugfix: NPE in constructor of Location
description:
There was a NPE when an exception was to be shown from the taclet instantiation editor.

Since there is no filename to be given to the contstructor, an NPE would be raised.

The fix simply checks for null.

/cc @pfeifer

- new AxiomCommand

title: Loop Scope Invariant Taclets
description:
Adds a set of new KeY taclets for loop scope-based invariant rules, and additional transformers and variable conditions, as well as some follow-up additions.

# Why? 

Taclets are more transparent and better maintainable than complex built-in rules. Just by constructing the taclet, two problems in the existing implementation (e.g., related to "free" invariants) have been discovered.

# Features and Impact

Loop scope invariant taclets, new rules for handling loop scopes. State of implementation in accordance with Dominic Steinhöfel's thesis. Also adds a sound three-branch rule that is less efficient, but potentially better suitable for teaching (@mulbrich: We discussed about this in the past).

Uses the new rules as a standard in the automaticJAVADL tests.

*Old proofs with the 3-branch transformation while rule still work*, and the rule can *still be used* in proof search by a strategy option. This MR does not remove the transformation-based rule. But: *This MR sets the new loop-scope invariant rule taclets as standard rules* for loop handling.

 Previous proofs with loop scopes will not work, since the loop scope rules have been changed.

# Persons involved

@wasser (loop scope inventor), @dsteinhoefel (implementation, newest formalization)

@mulbrich: You were involved in discussion about loop scope invariant rules and complex taclets like those in this MR, so you might have an opinion on this.

For text-book loop inv rule and semantics of loop scopes see [Dominic's thesis](https://tuprints.ulb.tu-darmstadt.de/8540/)

This branch is extracted from the AbstractExecution !172 branch.

title: Prevent DiskFileRepo from copying internal files from Jar
description:
Fixes the bug that internal files (JavaRedux, rules) where not detected as such (and thus copied to DiskFileRepo) if they where inside a jar file. Due to this bug, the `key.core-2.xxx.jar` has been copied to the classpath of DiskFileRepos which could make Jenkins run out of disk space.

In addition, resources handling in Recoder2KeY has been improved using `try-with-resources` statements. This prevents from some (unfortunately not all) problems on Windows of the following form: `File can not be deleted (currently in use by another process)`.

title: Fix method signature resolve in JML expressions
description: If query methods in JML expressions contained a boolean constant the type could not be resolved.

title: Support for Annotation Marker in JML
description:
This MR adds support for annotation marker in KeY.

Annotation markers are added in JML comments in the space between the comment start `//` or `/*` and the `@` sign.
These marker should be used to enable or disable features, mainly for activating/deactivating the interpretation a comment for a specific tool.

Markers are defined in [4.4 Annotation Marker in JML Reference](http://www.eecs.ucf.edu/~leavens/JML/jmlrefman/jmlrefman_4.html#SEC25)

:exclamation: This merge request allows annotation marker to appear in JML comments for KeY.

:exclamation: This merge request **deactivates** JML comments iff `-key` is given as an annotation marker (case insensitive).


## Implementation details 

Completely done by adapting the KeYJMLPreLexer: 

* The whitespace rule is broke up into multiple lexer rules.
* A semantic predicate and a lookahead decides, 
  whether up-coming comment should be recognise as a JML start or comment. 
  In general, we JML comments with `-key` marker are handled as comments.
  Refer to `isComment(start)` in `KeYJMLPreLexer.g` 

  - JML starters (`/*@`, `//+@`, etc ...): just the start is put on the hidden channel.
  - For comments (`/* @`, `//+`, `//-key@`): the start and the body of the comment (single/multiline) are put on the hidden channel. 

  - The hand-written code are required due to limitation of the antlr3 lexer.

* Newly added test cases (six) ensure a proper lexing. 


# Note  

**This is not a general support for annotation marker,** in the sense annotation marker 
could be used to disable/enable JML contracts via settings within key. 

Such a support would require a different handling of JML comments. 
Currently a bunch of JML comments are parsed together, that allow for example the following specification 
```
//@ ensures true &&
//@      false;
```
But is forbidden by the JML reference. We would need to split up the comments before parsing, 
and this would destroy several examples.

Fast merge due to dependency to student project.

In mission of @mulbrich 
cc: @rbubel

title: Fix a bug where origin labels for user interactions could not be parsed
description:
Fixes #1541.

The parser uses the SpecType.valueOf(s) function to parse origin labels. By default, SpecType.valueOf(s) function returns the enum element whose name is equal to "s".

Because the origin labels used the name "User_Interaction", but the enum element was named just "INTERACTION" instead of "USER_INTERACTION", the label could not be parsed.

title: Renovating the Jml Parser
description:
Renovation of the JML Parsing Facilities. This MR removes the `JavaJMLPreParser` and `JavaJMLParser`
by an antlr4 version.

## Features

- One Lexer and one grammar to handle JML
  - no pre-parsing necessary
  - Grammar is Java-free, Lexer requires minimal code.
  - Only one lexing and parsing pass is required for each comment.

## Todo

- InfFlowTests?
- consideration on `\accessible` vs. `\depends`
- Clarify: ```String label = ctx.lbl == null ? "" : ctx.lbl.getText(); //TODO weigl: right label if omitted```
  for continue and break.

## Changes

- This branch endeavours to keep compatibility with the legacy implementation on the external API and the 
  JML syntax and semantics. This also 
- [BREAKING] `\infinite_union` was dropped after a long period of deprecation; favor for `(\infinite_union ...)`
- [FIX] Chain of relational comparison, e.g. `x > y <= z`, is now correctly implemented.
  (An original version from @grahl was broken.) 
- New parser is more liberal on comments and white spaces, e.g. `//@ ensures */@ true;` is valid. 
- [NEW] assume statement `//@ assume x;` 
- [BREAKING]  No implicit grammar switch on represents clauses if left hand side is of type `\locset`. Use `\locset_of` instead. By example: 
  ```
  //@ represents footprint = x,y,a[*],other.footprint;  //old
  //@ represents footprint = \set_union( \locset_for(x), \locset_for(y), a[*], other.footprint) ;  //new 
  ```
- `requires` do not separates contracts anymore. e.g.,
  `requires true; assignable \nothing; requires true;` are recognized as two contracts in the old parser. 
   The new parser see this as one contracts. Use keyword `also` for seperataion.

For the sake of compatibility, this branch is not a complete rewrite of the grammar 
and also of the `speclang` packages. For example, we keep the `TextualJMLConstruct` classes. 

The next version may bring a re-design.

### Discussion

```
assignable o.f; (storeRefUnion == storeRef (',' storeRef)* ) 

             lhs      =   rhs 
represents footprints = <expr> 


\locset( Union of Field/Array Access )
\storeref( like assignable )
```

title: Completion Scopes
resolves #1537: user-provided notes are saved within the proof file
description:
This MR enables saving and loading of notes a user provided in the proof tree GUI.

# Remarks
* Notes are saved directly to the *.proof file, in the line where the corresponding rule application is stored:
```
(rule "<rulename>" (formula ...) ... (userinteraction) (notes "actual notes for the node"))
```
* To allow for saving/loading of double quotes (``"``), these are escaped with a backslash. Consequently, an actual backslash is escaped with a backslash as well. See [OutputStreamProofSaver.notes2Proof()](https://git.key-project.org/key/key/-/blob/015bb9f7dff8738f479e4a6797471c8af27e2749/key/key.core/src/main/java/de/uka/ilkd/key/proof/io/OutputStreamProofSaver.java#L692) for the implementation.

# Known Problems
* By design, notes attached to (open and closed) goals can not be saved/loaded, since the corresponding GUI node is not saved in the proof file.
* In the GUI, notes attached to a branch node are automatically attached to the first node below the branching node.

title: Generate Unit Tests for ProofCollections
description:
This is an extension for generating "run all proves unit tests". In contrast to !242, it is non intrusive and optional.

**In particular:** This MR adds a gradle-task `generateRunAllProofs` which generates Java files (Unit Tests). Each generated Java file is a unit test for a group given in the proof collections for *run-all-proofs*. 

**Helpful to (re-)run and debug a specific proof.**

Supersedes !242.

title: Minor changes for GI/Polyas proof
description:
Minor fixes, description follows.
*  Increased robustness and applicability of proof scripts

title: Fix for #1529 (lost error messages due to MalformedURLException)
description:
I fixed the problem by parsing the string to an URL (unit test is in TestMiscUtils).
However, in the long term the deprecated constructor `Location(String, int, int)` as well as method
`String getFilename()` should be avoided in favour of their URL versions.

Note: This fix also enables KeY to show the erroneous line if it is inside an internal rule file.
In my opinion this was possible never before:
Previously the line was not shown since the string contained an URL pointing into a jar file.
This URL could obviously not be opened as a file (using `Files.readAllLines()`).
Therefore this adds actually a (rather small) new ~Feature.

title: fixes #1528
description: See #1528 for a detailed description. The fix is also mentioned there. A test case has been added.

title: Pre-select previous selected contract in ProofManagementDialog
description:
Complained by @mulbrich: The `ProofManagementDialog` does not select the previous selected contract when reopened.

This MR resolves this by storing the key-java-type-name, method name and contract name into a static field, 
and tries to select these entities when the `ProofManagementDialog` is requested.

I used the names for identification, instead of storing the references to the `KeyJavaType`, `Contract` and `IProgramMethod` to avoid memory leaks.

title: URI encoding fix v2: Removed case distinction between Java versions
description:
* removed case distinction between Java versions
* added comment: java.net.URI does not support RFC 3986 -> problem when a directory name ends with "!"
* added test for reading bytes from jar url

# Known Bug
Java's URI implements [RFC 2396 (obsolete since 2005!)](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2396), where `!` is defined as unreserved character.
This means, it is not encoded to `%21`. However, since `!/` is defined as separator for jar urls, this leads to problems:
If a directory name in the jar path ends with `!`, this is interpreted as the separator. Obviously, the resulting "jar file" is not correct and a FileNotFoundException occurs.
This can not be fixed by us until Java's URI implements correct escaping (`!` as reserved character, see [RFC 3986](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986) which obsoletes 2396). Since this implementation would break compatibility to current URIs, it seems that there are no plans for this.
### Links
* https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8019345
* https://cr.openjdk.java.net/~dfuchs/writeups/updating-uri
* https://mail.openjdk.java.net/pipermail/net-dev/2019-February/012191.html

title: Various changes for GI/Polyas proof
description:
This branch contains various fixes and new features that were necessary for the GI/Polyas proof:

Features:
- Proof statistics can be exported in HTML or CSV format.
- Various small additions to proof scripts.

Fixes:
- Add taclets to apply static invariants. Fixes #1345.
- The naming of "Use_information_flow_" taclets is now deterministic and persists when saving and loading the proof.
- When applying a side proof, the namespaces of the main proof and side proof are merged to prevent the same functions being added twice.
- Fixed a problem where some rule instantiations could not be applied when running a proof script.
- Information flow contracts no longer ignore "requires_free" statements.

title: Fix for exception due to wrong encoding in URI
description:
The current master fails with an URISyntaxException because my newly written method to extract an URI from a DataLocation does not handle spaces (in general: special characters in URIs) correctly. This branch provides a fix for this bug.

Note that Java (prior to version 9 b80) has a bug when converting a path obtained from a ZipFileSystem to a URI
(see https://bugs.java.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=8131067).
Therefore it will be necessary to delete seven lines of code from `MiscTools.java` when migrating to a Java version higher than that.

title: Revert "Merge branch 'weigl/ExDialogCenter' into 'master'"
description: This reverts merge request !281

title: Exception Dialog in Center
description:
This MR aligns the ExceptionDialog in the center of the main window. 
This prevents an appearance of this on secondary displays.

title: Gradle files need cleaning and documentation
description:
The introduction of gradle was great for KeY.
Development is way more flexible now, and we can use libraries much more easily.

However, the configuration files should be made readable and maintainable.

title: Renovating the KeY Parser
description:
**A rewrite of the KeYParser and KeYLexer in ANTLR4 including new facades.**

### Features 

* Java-code free grammar!
* The lexer is nearly Java-code free. The exception is the handling of `NUM_LITERAL` followed by an LPAREN '`(`' needed for function decls like `numbers 0 (numbers);`.
* Facades for encapsulation:
  * `KeyIO` provides an high-level facade for parsing and evaluation of KeY files.
     - This facade delivers key objects (Term, Seq, etc..) for given `CharStream`s, `String`s or `Path`s.
  * `ParsingFacade` is the low-level facade.
     - This facades abstracts the building of `KeYLexer` and `KeYParser`.
  * We use `KeyAst.*` *monads* to hide the the parse tree from the developer. 
  * There should never be a dependency to the parser, lexer or visitor classes directly.
* All building and analysis is done on the parse tree.
* Integration into `ProblemInitializer`, `KeyFile` and `DefaultTermParser`. 
* Better user feedback on ill-formed inputs:
  - `TermCreationException` are now enriched with errornous parse tree node and position info (file, line, char)
  - Every taclet has an origin information (file:line). Also visible in `InfoView`.
  - Every term, that is created by the parser, has given an origin information (file:line).
  - Better feedback (difference between grammar or semantic error) will be enabled.

### Changes:

* The grammar is already a bit simplified:
  - No distinguishing between problem and declaration file. 
  - Some rules were slightly rewritten to decrease the ambiguities 
  - Requirement of flag orders reduce
* [BREAKING] `KeyParserF` and `KeyLexerF` are removed
* There was a few bugs in Key files that were not recognise 
  by the old parser due to option selective parsing with never used taclet options.
  - This might be *break some of your proofs*, for example choices are handled more correctly. In particular
    `sort.key`in quicksort was not provable anymore (due to missing taclet)
    and required a `\withOption moreSeqRules:on` entry.
* [BREAKING] One `varcond` grammar rule to handle them all!
  - Variable Conditions are handled dynamically. Currently, you have to do three things: 
    define a token in the KeyLexer, add the token to the list of `varcondId` and add a builder to the list of 
    `TacletBuilderCommand`s.
  - All existing conditions are migrated.
  - Changes to the grammar, and KeY files where needed, because some variable conditions rules did not following the rules.
    (namely: `\hasSort`, `\new`).
    - `\new` is split into `\new`, `\newDependingOn`, `\newTypeOf`.
    - `\hasSort` is split into `\hasSort` and `\hasElementarySort`. 
  - In future version, we might replace the list of varcondId-tokens by an identifier. 
    This will not break the interface.
* `DefaultTermParser` is deprecated in favor for KeyIO.

### Working:

- All tests: parsing, proofing etc. on key.core are passed flawlessly. 
- Parsing of key problems, including Java problems.
  - This means that also the complete `standardRules.key` and included files are parseable and interpretable.
  - Auto mode is also working on the loaded problems
- Reloading of proofs.
  - I fear that loading a huge proof file (300MB and upwards) into a parse tree is not the right idea.
  - Proofs are sexpr, that could be handled into a SAX manner (event based).
  - My suggestion: We keep proofs out of the `KeYParser`. 
    If the `\proof`is hit by the lexer, the lexer emits the PROOF token and also EOF.
    This stops the token stream and prevents the parser from analysation of the sexpr. 
    But we can recognise on the parse tree that there is a proof stored in the given file.
    And we could also use the `KeyParser` to find all other informations.
  - On a second step, we would reopen the file, seek to the `\proof` position and start lexing 
    with very simply lexer for sexpr on a token per token base. 
  - Each token is analysed after another and translated into actions on the proof tree, see `IProofFileParser`.
  - This have to be implemented into `KeYUserProblemFile#readProof`.  

### Known Bugs

- Symbolic execution and proof reference have failed test cases. 



### Old

- Loading on the first file/problem works. But if you want to load another problem following exception is thrown
```
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: A rule named poolKeyIsContentOfValuehas already been registered.
	at de.uka.ilkd.key.proof.mgt.RuleJustificationInfo.addJustification(RuleJustificationInfo.java:38)
	at de.uka.ilkd.key.proof.init.InitConfig.registerRule(InitConfig.java:316)
	at de.uka.ilkd.key.proof.init.InitConfig.registerRules(InitConfig.java:334)
	at de.uka.ilkd.key.proof.init.ProblemInitializer.setUpProofHelper(ProblemInitializer.java:427)
	at de.uka.ilkd.key.proof.init.ProblemInitializer.startProver(ProblemInitializer.java:573)
	at de.uka.ilkd.key.proof.io.AbstractProblemLoader.createProof(AbstractProblemLoader.java:581)
	at de.uka.ilkd.key.proof.io.AbstractProblemLoader.load(AbstractProblemLoader.java:281)
	at de.uka.ilkd.key.proof.io.ProblemLoader.doWork(ProblemLoader.java:78)
	at de.uka.ilkd.key.proof.io.ProblemLoader$1.doInBackground(ProblemLoader.java:124)
	at de.uka.ilkd.key.proof.io.ProblemLoader$1.doInBackground(ProblemLoader.java:117)
	at java.desktop/javax.swing.SwingWorker$1.call(SwingWorker.java:304)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:264)
	at java.desktop/javax.swing.SwingWorker.run(SwingWorker.java:343)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1128)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:628)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:834)
```

- Wenn ich zB. contraposition.key beweise und speichere fehlen die `sorts` und `predicates`.
Vermutlich müssen diese Deklaration gesondert gekennzeichnet werden. Aktuell lese ich die Declaration von einer `KeYUserProblemFile` ein, wie ich es auch bei einer `KeYFile` mache. 


### Work In Progress

- It is not easily possible to specify a left recursive form for the KeY-Grammar due to strange precedence rules.

milestone.title: v2.10.0
milestone.description:
The next major version after 2.8.0. 

We decided the following in the KaKeY meetings:
* feature freeze: November 15th
* subsequently: testing by Hiwis
* first week of December: testing and bug fixing event with staff
* release date: shortly prior to christmas, such that it is available for teaching in formal methods course

title: fix #1525
description:
* added public modifier
* add test case

title: fix #1523
description:
* reimplemented applySettings, clean up class (reduced stored data)
* tested by setting values and restart

title: Deterministic testcase order
description:
Currently, the order of test cases/suites may differ between two Jenkins runs because of obscure reasons.
This leads to strange situations where subsequent runs show different test results.

A case where this happened is:
Jenkins tests failed for commit a0649a995e00b2013810c55bcab0767723681895, but passed for its parent d0efecf9fbf7ef4194920c319eaa1671990a16ee.
While there were changes, they had nothing to do with the different test results.
Instead, the test execution order of the two runs massively differed, which caused some unrelated tests to fail
(see https://git.key-project.org/key/key/merge_requests/271#note_11119).

Probably the best solution was to make the tests independent from execution order.
However, this is clearly out or reach.
Instead, this merge request makes the test order deterministic (alphabetically sorted test classes).

title: Robustness improvement of PositionInfo
description:
PositionInfo class now uses URIs instead of Strings to denote the file/parentClass.
This improves robustness as well as flexibility (e.g. PositionInfo can now point to files inside jar archives).

title: Fix for bug in URL to Path conversion on Windows (SimpleFileRepo)
description: On Windows machines, SimpleFileRepo throws an Exception ("Illegal character ':' in path"), because URLs are not correctly converted to Paths. This MR fixes this.

title: Prevent NPE when loading relative paths via CLI
description: solves #1524

title: Quick patch for Bug #1520
description: Closes #1520

title: Allow macro application via keyboard shortcut from tree
description:
Quite a while ago, I fixed this issue (perhaps not filed here?) that macro keyboard shortcuts can sometimes be applied from an inner node and can sometimes not be applied. Unfortunately on some branch somewhere else.

I suggest that this be cherry-picked to %"v2.8.0" also.

title: Fix Windows-specific source view bugs
description:
Fixes some Windows-specific source view bugs.

Due to a bug in Recoder2KeY, also noted by Wolfram [here](https://git.key-project.org/key/key/issues/1513#note_10355), KeY's file paths have an illegal format on Windows ("/C:/path/to/file/", the slash at the beginning is illegal) which the File constructor silently converts to "C:\path\to\file".

This lead to the SourceView opening every file twice and not showing any symbolic execution highlights.

This merge request does not fix the underlying problem in Recoder2Key, but it does fix the behavior of the source view on Windows.

title: Fixes of taclet and extension settings
description: Mostly easier accessibility and one fix of a prior GUI bug.

title: Some More GUI Harmonizations
description: Various upper/lower case harmonizations, also minor fixes of showing only eligible settings.

title: Bugfix for #1504
description: See [note](https://git.key-project.org/key/key/issues/1504#note_10906) for #1504.

title: Fix source view not showing any files for certain nodes
description: This fixes a small bug where the source view would not show any files for certain nodes. The files would sometimes reappear after continuing the proof

title: Cope with Alexander's new naming pattern
description: No branch is shown for major version. Added a hyphen as @weigl did on the branch.

title: Resolve regressions with docking framework
description:
This hopfully fixes #1509.

It's UI-only modification.

Fix spotted by Alexander Weigl.

title: Enables selection of proof in Proof Differences view
description:
Includes !255.

This MR enables the proof difference between proofs.

The user is able to select the proof for the left and right of the comparison.

![image](/uploads/d1a7da32b83ba350c86f2780cadd68a0/image.png)

**This MR is separately becomes of the impact:**

* `KeYMediator` got a new member variable `DefaultListModel` to hold a list of `currentlyOpenedProofs`.
* The `TaskView` adds and removes proofs to this list.

title: Fix Proof Differences
description:
This MR fixes and improves the new proof differences view.

1. IMP: UI becomes simpler and MR also enables the editing of the `serialNr`
1. IMP: `HelpFacade` got a new function `createHelpFunction` which constructs a help button for the dock title bar.
1. IMP: The view is now documented under: https://key-project.org/docs/Using%20KeY/NodeDiff/
1. IMP: `Proof` got a new function `findAny(Predicate<Node>)` to bf-search for a node.

Due to (1) and (2) this should be included in to %"v2.8.0"

title: Logging
description:
This MR brings sfl4j in KeY.

- Why a logging framework when `System.out.println` works?!?!
  - KeY is planned as a library, that should be usable by other tools. In this environment we are not allowed spamming the console. 
  - `println`s are hard to trace down, logging messages not. If you want to know where a logging message came from, you simple add caller information to format string. 
  - You can not distinguish between a handled exception with an output of `e.printStrackTrace()` 
    and an unhandled one on the console.
  - Logging supports different information levels, with different information sinks. 
  - You can configure logging at runtime.
  - You do not need if-statements with `Debug.isDebug` or `verbosity >= Verbosity.SILENT`. 
  - We can gather a log file which can be send with the feedback function.
  - Reliable in server and concurrent situations.

- Why sfl4j? 

sfl4j is a generic logging API with adapter for several implementations. Using slf4j keeps the dependency profile small for the libraries. A full logging library is required at runtime (only).
Therefore, if KeY is embedded as a library in a program, the developers can decide which logging library they want use.

- Why not `java.util.logging`?
  `jul` is the crippled try of SUN to mimic `log4j`. Implementation is such mess that except of some SUN projects (like Glassfish) nobody use it. The disadvantages starts with the strange log levels and ends with memory leakage, and configuration issues. 

- Why not `log4j2` or `logback` or `tinylog`?
  - These options are not bad, but we would be bound to a specific logging library. If KeY is used as a library in a system with a different library logging would complicate the integration. Using `slf4j` is the industrial-default to avoid this issues. A competitor from the apache graveyard is *Apache Commons Logging*. 

### This MR configures `slf4j` in the following way:

* Every projects depends on `slf4j-api`.
* `key.ui` also includes `logback-classic` -- an slf4j adapter. 
  Logback is configured in the following way:
  - Everything informational and above is reported to STDOUT. 
  - Everything is reported into the `$(pwd)/key.log` with more details.
    The file is overwritten (non-append, non-rolling).
* For testing we fall back to `slf4j-simple`, a minimalistic adapter.
  - During testing, only warnings are reported. If you require more information, adapt `simplelogger.properties`. 
* Logging information is coupled with `--verbosity` of the CLI.

title: Loading of single Java files.
description:
This commit offers a new action for the user: the loading of single Java
files.

If you load/open a Java in the traditional way, KeY considers the path
of the Java as part of the classpath. Hence, all Java files found
recursively under the given folder are parsed.

This commit adds a new action, and extends the core facilities to avoid
this behaviour.

# Why is this needed?

- The default case in KeY is loading a Java file, that contains all
  resources and only depends on the JDK.

- The traditional behaviour is misleading for KeY newbies.

Unclear, whether merge for %"v2.8.0"  or later.

title: Pfeifer1468consistent saving
description:
This branch adds the ability to select which proof from a proof bundle shall be loaded.
In addition, the SourceView now loads its content from the FileRepo if available.

# Features and Impact
* If multiple proofs are present in a proof bundle, allow the user to select one to load
 (in future, it will be possible to load more than one, but not for KeY 2.8).
* The SourceView loads its content from the FileRepo if available, thus keeping it consistent with the proof.

# Persons involved

@pfeifer
@mulbrich

title: Fix bug in AbstractPropertiesSettings.java

* Properties#contains is broken

The effect was that changes in, e.g., the ViewSettings (such as whether the sequent should be displayed using unicode symbols) could not be changed persistently, and the default settings would be applied when restarting KeY.
